questions.question_text: When a ServiceNow instance requests information from a web service, ServiceNow is the web service:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
"A web service consumer (client) requests information from a web service provider (server). A web service provider processes the request and returns a status code and a response body."

https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/learning-plans/tokyo/technology_partner_program_1/app_store_learnv2_rest_tokyo_servicenow_as_a_web_service_consumer

Selected Answer: D
d is ok

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is the fastest way to create and configure a Record Producer?

choices.A: Create a Catalog Category, open the category, and select the Add New Record Producer button
choices.B: Use the Record Producer module then add and configure all variables manually
choices.C: Open the table in the Table records and select the Add to Service Catalog Related Link
choices.D: Open the table's form, right-click on the form header, and select the Create Record Producer menu item

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct as the simplest way is to click the related link which say "Publish to Service catalog"

Selected Answer: C
is told in course
C is correct
C, Link at the bottom of the table

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
This also how it is done in the ADF course lab.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a trigger type in Flow Designer?

discussion.content:
A is the correct answer.
These are the triggers for a Flow in ServiceNow:

Record
 -Created
-Updated 
-Created or Updated

Scheduled
-Daily
-Weekly
-Monthly
-Run once
-Repeat

Application
-SLA Task
-Inbound Email 
-Service Catalog

Selected Answer: A
A is correct answer.

comments.content: Schedule is the wrong answer. Answers must be messed up. Outbound email is a wrong answer too.

discussion.content:
Should be A and D. Flow designer trigger types are Application, Record, Date..
So in this case we kinda considering D schedule as Date, which is weird..

Selected Answer: A
Outbound email is not a trigger type

Selected Answer: A
Just go and check

Selected Answer: A
Answer A

questions.question_text: Which objects can you use in a Scheduled Script Execution (Scheduled Job) script?

discussion.content: Correct answer is C. You can only use server side scripting in Scheduled Jobs.

Selected Answer: C
there is no user nor current in scheduled job

Selected Answer: C
it has no access to current: https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/learning-plans/tokyo/servicenow_administrator/app_store_learnv2_automatingapps_tokyo_scheduled_script_execution_scripts

Selected Answer: C
C is correct - you don't have a user or current in a scheduled job

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Correct answer is C refer to https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/learning-plans/quebec/servicenow_administrator/app_store_learnv2_automatingapps_quebec_scheduled_script_execution_scripts

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C the code examples in the book use the GlideRecord and GlideSystem

comments.content: D is incorrect. "Scheduled Script Executions are not associated with records and have no access to the previous or current objects used by many other server-side script types."

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D, as the gs object and current object can be directly used, for rest other you need to initialize the class into the object.

questions.question_text: Can inherited fields be deleted from a table?

choices.A: Yes, select the red X in the left-most column in the table definition
choices.C: Yes, but only if there has never been any saved field data
choices.B: Yes, but only if they are text fields
choices.D: No, inherited fields cannot be deleted from a child table

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Cannot be deleted from child table directly, you need to open the record and then delete it.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
D, Per CAD class slide from SNOW

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Cannot delete
